nodes.title: Article 3
nodes.summary: This partial document details the official uniforms mandated for sworn forestry inspectors, officials, and agents. It specifies two distinct sets of attire: a "service and town" uniform and an "inspection and surveillance" uniform, listing the specific garments, materials, colors, and details for each.

nodes.title: Article 6
nodes.summary: This partial document details the rank insignia for various forestry officer positions. It specifies that insignia are worn as stripes on the outer sleeves of the jacket. The description lists the number and material (silver or scarlet cloth) of stripes for each rank, from Principal Forest Inspector down to 1st Class Forest Guard, and notes that there is no distinct insignia for the 2nd Class Forest Guard.

nodes.title: Article 9
nodes.summary:
This partial document contains two primary sections: a legal decree and a correspondence table. The decree, dated November 5, 2002 in Kinshasa, is issued by Salomon Banamuhere Baliene and assigns responsibility for its execution to the Secretary General for Environment and Conservation of Nature. It includes a standard enactment clause.

The main substantive content is the "Tableau de Correspondance des Grades" (Grade Correspondence Table). This table aligns forestry service ranks (A) with equivalent ranks in the State Public Services career path (B). It lists seven specific equivalencies, mapping forestry inspector and guard positions (e.g., Inspecteur forestier principal, Garde forestier) to administrative roles like Director, Division Chief, and various classes of bureau attachés and agents.

The document concludes with a note that the table is annexed to a specific ministerial order, and includes a disclaimer stating the site is under construction and that the texts are provided by associations without assuming responsibility for them.
